meanings.definition: A mild expression of surprise or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: She exclaimed, 'Gee, I can't believe it!'
meanings.sent4: The news was so exciting, it made everyone go 'gee!'
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display left everyone in awe, saying 'gee' repeatedly.

meanings.sent1: The driver signaled with a 'gee' to make the turn.
meanings.sent2: In horse riding, 'gee' means to go right.
meanings.sent3: The GPS said, 'gee', so we turned right.
meanings.sent4: The captain shouted 'gee' as the ship veered to starboard.
meanings.sent5: The instructor's 'gee' guided the team to the correct direction.

meanings.sent1: He made a lot of 'gee' from his business.
meanings.sent2: She asked for some 'gee' to buy a new dress.
meanings.sent3: I need more 'gee' to go shopping this weekend.
meanings.sent4: His pockets were full of 'gee' after the successful deal.
meanings.sent5: The thief's eyes gleamed at the sight of the stolen 'gee'.
